posts.content:
Hi! I am trying to build a pure Tyr paladin. I'd like something worth in PvM and PvP versus evil aligned.

The server where i play has lot of modifications that only take place if you go pure class.

Here they are (the normal feats and bonus stat points still apply):

Bonus feats:
-lvl 2 Extra Smite
-Lvl 5 Bonus stat point
-Lvl 6 Divine power
-Lvl 9 Divine shield
-Lvl 10 Bonus stat point + Great Smite1 (if cha 19)
-Lvl 15 Bonus stat point + Great smite2 (if cha 21)
-Lvl 20 Bonus stat point + Great smite 3 (if cha 23)
-lvl 25 Bonus stat point + bonus Great smite (if cha 25)
-lvl 30 Bonus sta point + bonus great smite (if cha 25)
-lvl 35 Bonus stat point
-lvl 40 bonus stat point

Epic feat progression is 1 every 3 levels, Great strenght, great che and great dex are class epic feats.

My thanks to anyone who whises to help :)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Well, not many ways you can build that it is obvious that they want to support the classic charismatic knight so you need to focus on that (at least at first) and then put your remaining points into strength. I am assuming this is for a level forty environment and  that devastating critical is allowed (you have to tell us how effective it can be though.) The bonus stats help a lot in this build as do the bonus feats.

posts.author: Nekro83
posts.content: Devastating critical has beeen modified, now it increases the crit multiplier ( es x2 becomes x3, x4 becomes x5. does not apply to scimitars and rapiers)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Alright, here is your Paladin Necro, I worked on it for a couple of hours and although these days I don't make NwN builds anymore and I am a bit rusty, I think it came up fairly competent. Great smite 10 and Devastating Critical plus a good 42 AB naked will have you covered in both PvE and PvP. This build goes over 80 AB with just a good taunt and some buffs while attempting a great smite and the damage is bonkers if you have a critical one. I would like a bit more hit points for a melee character personally but with divine shield giving you up to 14 more AC, you won't be exactly what we could call "helpless". Finally, some epic feats might need some shuffling around, depending what you want to achieve first, but that is easy to tinker with.
